intro: Aporum basilanense, commonly known as the Basilan starfruit, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped fruits. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers are small and clustered, producing a unique fragrance that attracts pollinators.
